frame.name: Clothing_parts
frame.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Subpart</fen>s of <fen>Clothing</fen> items worn by a <fen>Wearer</fen> and made of a certain <fen>Material</fen>. The <fen>Subpart</fen> may itself have parts, which we label <fen>Subregion</fen>:
<ex>The shirt features a long <t>sleeve</t> <fex name="Subregion">with shiny gold buttons</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Clothing
FE.definition:
<def-root>This is the <fen>Clothing</fen> of which the target word is a part.
<ex>His <fex name="clo">trouser</fex> <t>pocket</t>...</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Subpart
FE.definition:
<def-root>This is a <fen>Subpart</fen> of the <fen>Clothing</fen> item.
<ex>His trouser <fex name="Subpart"><t>pocket</t></fex>...</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Material
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Material</fen> from which the <fen>Subpart</fen> is made.
<ex>He wore a jacket with a <fex name="mat">fur</fex> <t>collar</t>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Subregion
FE.definition:
<def-root>A part of the <fen>Clothing</fen> item.
<ex>a shirt <fex name="Subregion">with long sleeves</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Wearer
FE.definition:
<def-root>The person who is wearing the clothes, or for whom the clothes are intended.
<ex><fex name="Wear">He</fex> wore a filthy leather miniskirt.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Body_location
FE.definition:
<def-root>This is the part of the body were the garment is worn.
<ex>He had a stocking <fex name="BLoc">over his head</fex>.</ex> <ex>He put gloves <fex name="BLoc">on his hands</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifes any description of the clothing besides <fen>Material</fen>.
<ex>He shoved his left hand into a <fex name="Des">deep</fex> pant <t>pocket</t>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: bootlace.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a cord or leather strip for lacing boots.

lexUnit.name: shoelace.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a cord or leather strip passed through eyelets or hooks on opposite sides of a shoe and pulled tight and fastened.

lexUnit.name: lace.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a cord or leather strip passed through eyelets or hooks to fasten a shoe or garment.

lexUnit.name: button.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small disc or knob sewn on to a garment, either to fasten it by being pushed through a buttonhole or for decoration.

lexUnit.name: zip.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: chiefly Brit. a fastener consisting of two flexible strips of metal or plastic with interlocking projections closed or opened by pulling a slide along them.

lexUnit.name: zipper.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a zip fastener.

lexUnit.name: buckle.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a flat rectangular or oval frame with a hinged pin, used for joining the ends of a belt or strap.

lexUnit.name: snap.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a press stud

lexUnit.name: thong.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a narrow strip of leather or other material, used especially as a fastening or as the lash of a whip.

lexUnit.name: collar.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a band of material around the neck of a shirt or other garment, either upright or turned over.

lexUnit.name: neck.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a narrow connecting or end part.

lexUnit.name: sleeve.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the part of a garment that wholly or partly covers a person's arm.

lexUnit.name: cuff.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a.the end part of a sleeve, where the material of the sleeve is turned back or a separate band is sewn on

lexUnit.name: waist.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: part of the clothing below the ribs and above the hips.

lexUnit.name: tassel.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a tuft of hanging threads, knotted together at one end and used for decoration in soft furnishing and clothing.

lexUnit.name: fringe.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a border of threads, tassels, or twists, used to edge clothing or material. [Clothing] [Textiles]

lexUnit.name: pocket.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small bag sewn into or on clothing so as to form part of it, used for carrying small articles.

lexUnit.name: braid.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: mass noun threads of silk, cotton, etc. woven into a decorative band.

lexUnit.name: seat.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: clothing that covers a person's buttocks.

lexUnit.name: leg.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a part of a garment covering a leg or part of a leg.

lexUnit.name: sash.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a long strip of cloth sewn around the waist of a dress

lexUnit.name: strap.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a strip of leather, cloth, or other flexible material, used for fastening, securing, carrying, or holding on to.

lexUnit.name: hood.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a covering for the head and neck with an opening for the face, typically part of a coat or cloak. [Clothing]

lexUnit.name: cowl.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large loose hood forming part of a monk's habit.

lexUnit.name: skirt.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the part of a coat or dress that hangs below the waist.

lexUnit.name: breastplate.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a piece of armour covering the chest.

lexUnit.name: waist-band.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a strip of cloth encircling the waist, attached to a skirt or a pair of trousers. (listed as waistband)

lexUnit.name: clasp.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small device with interlocking parts used for fastening things together.

lexUnit.name: seam.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a line where two pieces of fabric are sewn together in a garment or other article.

lexUnit.name: placket.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an opening or slit in a garment, covering fastenings or for access to a pocket, or the flap of fabric under such an opening.

lexUnit.name: monogram.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a motif of two or more interwoven letters, typically a person's initials

lexUnit.name: decolletage.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a low neck-line

lexUnit.name: cuff-link.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a device for fastening together the sides of a shirt cuff, passed through a hole in each side of the cuff.

lexUnit.name: hem.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the edge of a piece of cloth or clothing which has been turned under and sewn.

lexUnit.name: insole.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a thin, flat sole-shaped liner worn in a shoe or boot

lexUnit.name: waistband.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a strip of cloth encircling the waist, attached to a skirt or a pair of trousers.

lexUnit.name: waistline.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the part of a garment that is shaped or constructed to fit at or near the waist.

lexUnit.name: sole.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the section forming the underside of a piece of footwear.

lexUnit.name: brim.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the projecting edge around the bottom of a hat.

lexUnit.name: neckband.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a strip of material round the neck of a garment
